unnormalised: **Automotive News: Fuel Efficiency Gains Momentum in India**
normalised: **Automotive News: Fuel Efficiency Gains Momentum in India**

unnormalised: New Delhi, October 26th - As petrol prices hover around Rs. 105 per litre, fuel efficiency is becoming a major deciding factor for Indian car buyers. A recent study by IIT Madras highlights the significant improvements manufacturers are making.
normalised: New Delhi, October twenty sixth - As petrol prices hover around rupee one hundred and five per liter, fuel efficiency is becoming a major deciding factor for Indian car buyers. A recent study by I I T Madras highlights the significant improvements manufacturers are making.

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma, lead researcher, noted that average fuel efficiency across popular models has increased by 15% in the last five years. Factors contributing include lighter materials, smaller engine displacements, and advanced aerodynamic designs.
normalised: Doctor Sharma, lead researcher, noted that average fuel efficiency across popular models has increased by fifteen percent in the last five years. Factors contributing include lighter materials, smaller engine displacements, and advanced aerodynamic designs.

unnormalised: Maruti Suzuki and Tata Motors are leading the charge, with models boasting mileage figures exceeding 25 kmpl. Even SUVs, traditionally fuel-guzzlers, are seeing significant improvements. Government initiatives, like the Bharat Stage VI emission standards, are also playing a vital role.
normalised: Maruti Suzuki and Tata Motors are leading the charge, with models boasting mileage figures exceeding twenty five kilometer per liter. Even S U Vs, traditionally fuel-guzzlers, are seeing significant improvements. Government initiatives, like the Bharat Stage six emission standards, are also playing a vital role.

unnormalised: Experts suggest that further gains can be achieved through widespread adoption of hybrid and electric technologies, alongside infrastructural improvements like well-maintained roads. Investing in fuel-efficient vehicles not only saves money but also reduces carbon footprint, contributing to a cleaner India. Consider fuel efficiency ratings when purchasing your next car. A slight increase can save you a substantial amount of money over the lifetime of the vehicle, perhaps enough to buy that extra 500 sq ft of land in your native village.
normalised: Experts suggest that further gains can be achieved through widespread adoption of hybrid and electric technologies, alongside infrastructural improvements like well-maintained roads. Investing in fuel-efficient vehicles not only saves money but also reduces carbon footprint, contributing to a cleaner India. Consider fuel efficiency ratings when purchasing your next car. A slight increase can save you a substantial amount of money over the lifetime of the vehicle, perhaps enough to buy that extra five hundred square feet of land in your native village.
